website_summaries.verdict: Super lightweight down-blend insulated jacket good for a mild winter or crisp fall.
pros: A solid choice for a thin but warm jacket
Good price (variety of colors to choose from, some colors cheaper)
cons: Too thin for some reviewers – more like a liner than a jacket

customer_reviews.title: Is this REALLY what has become of "fashion"?
customer_reviews.text: Really, this is what we have come to in "fashion". I see this type of jacket everywhere. It is like they took the liner out of a real winter jacket and sold it separately and for a HIGH PRICE. These things must cost about $5 to manufacture in Chinanam. It serves its purpose, but it is like getting a hamburger for a steak price. It is lightweight, but then everything that has little material is lightweight. If they sold it by the pound it would cost 5 cents.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Crayon
customer_reviews.text: I got it for $40.08. For that price is 5 star. However for anything over $70 I go with Tommy one which packs in a bag. This one doesn’t. It feels warm. The color is very different and to my taste. It is not matte not shiny, it’s like crayon. There is enough room for layers and the cut is ok. More practical to fashionable although the color really stands out.
customer_reviews.author: Reza M.

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: I think Columbia lost the connection with the design reality! This jacket feels like you are wearing a thick plastic bag and also does not keep you warm in Chicago's climate.

customer_reviews.title: Have realistic expectations and you'll be happy
customer_reviews.text: Wore this jacket in 20 degree temps at night in Breckenridge. Coupled with a fleece and scarf and I was nice and warm. Plus it looks great. Have realistic expectations, this is not a super puffy down jacket, and I don't know how well it would handle in below 20 temps, but for me it was perfect.

customer_reviews.title: Something not right.
customer_reviews.text: Something about this jacket is not right. I bought four for my staff, had them embroidered with company logo. No one has been able to wear it, myself included. It remains flat and compressed, looks odd, doesn't relax after washing. I tried washing it again this weekend in hope it would fix it, but is still flat and looks almost ironed. Something not right, none of my staff have been able to get one cent of use out of this, really disappointing. Would not buy again needless to say.

product_meta.title: Columbia Sportswear Men's Flash Forward Down Jacket
product_meta.description: When the weather turns chilly, this lightweight, packable 650 fill-power down jacket will help keep you warm and snug. HEAT SEAL ''no-sew'' bonded baffles reduces water penetration and keeps down from migrating, giving it a modern, sleek and streamlined aesthetic. Perfect for mild winter conditions or as a layering piece on colder days. HEAT SEAL technology eliminates baffled stitches, so the down stays in and the cold stays out. Water resistant fabric. Insulation: 76 grams of 650 fill power down. Zippered hand pockets. Binding at hem and cuffs. Center Back Length: 28''. Material: Polyester.
feature_bullets: Shell: 100% Polyester Taffeta. Lining: 100% Polyester. Insulation: 100% 650 Fill Power Down
Quilted down jacket featuring zippered hand pockets and water-resistant fabrication
Insulation: 76 grams of 650 fill power down
